page.title: 18Woodham Ferrers Housing
page.content: There is very little house building taking place in the old village of Woodham Ferrers. The majority of the buildings span 150 years the oldest 300 years. Parts of the church date from the Norman conquest. The village is of linear development & new building work is mainly filling in extensions or other improvement work. Many roof timbers are prefabricated. Outer walls are generally of brick construction. The inner walls may be brick or block such as celcon. Many houses have wooden frames inside walls Heating is by gas,oil,coal,electricity People are encouraged to insulate their homes by double glazing lagging the roof and cavity insulation but there has been some controvesy over the latter.Most people have mortgages. Council homes are being sold off & not replaced. The village is green belt.
